sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"唤醒，醒来"之意。
means: rouse ： 较正式用词，用主动语态时，强调弄醒别人的努力，用被动语态时，指轻而易举地醒过来。可用于引申意义。
arouse ： 除表示一般的唤醒外，多作引申用。
awake ： 正式用词，常指觉醒、警惕的状态，也多用于比喻。
wake ： 普通常用词，指真正的醒来。即可作及物动词也可作不及物动词。
waken ： 书面用词，常用于被动态和引申意义。

word_mean: 绕物体流动在边界层分离点下游所形成的旋涡区。
物体后面，由物体上边界层内流来的或由分离引起的充满涡流的流动区域。

sentence.Network_en: Adam stumbles on, leaving a trail of devastation in his wake.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚当蹒跚而行，沿路留下毁坏的痕迹。

sentence.Network_en: In his wake came a waiter wheeling a trolley.
sentence.Network_cn: 一位推着手推车的侍者紧随着他过来。

sentence.Network_en: You will wake to find film crews camped in your backyard.
sentence.Network_cn: 一觉醒来，你会发现电影摄制组进驻了你家后院。

phrase.cizu_name: wake up and smell the coffee

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. in imperative](informal, chiefly N. Amer.)become aware of the realities of a situation, however unpleasant
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)清醒一点，面对现实

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (recorded only in the past tense wōc), also partly from the weak verb wacian 'remain awake, hold a vigil', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch waken and German wachen; compare with watch
late 15th cent. (denoting a track made by a person or thing): probably via Middle Low German from Old Norse vǫk, vaka 'hole or opening in ice'

encyclopedia.content: 这是导演Henry LeRoy Finch首次编剧和执导的作品，他的妻子Susan Landau是制片人，Susan的爸爸马丁·兰道 （曾获奥斯卡奖） 在片中客串出演了老年Sebastian一角。电影在美国东北部缅因州一家1745年建立的老房子里拍摄的。这部片子是夫妻俩低成本独立电影制作的实验品，全片用数码照相机拍摄，后期制作是在电脑上加入电影效果完成。影片讲叙四兄弟之间纠葛的恩怨情仇。导演对家庭的题材似乎很感兴趣，这是他撰写家庭三部曲中的一部，也是他第一部执拍的作品。

entry.def: When you wake or when someone or something wakes you, you become conscious again after being asleep.

example.ex: It was cold and dark when I woke at 6.30...
example.tran: 我6点半醒来时，天又冷又黑。

example.ex: Bob woke slowly to sunshine pouring in his window...
example.tran: 直到阳光从窗外泻入，鲍勃才慢慢醒来。

entry.tran: (航行中的船等留下的)伴流，尾流，航迹
entry.def: The wake of a boat or other object moving in water is the track of waves that it makes behind it as it moves through the water.

example.ex: The ride was smooth until they got into the merchant ship's wake...
example.tran: 航行一直很顺利，直到他们碰上了商船的尾流。

example.ex: Dolphins sometimes play in the wake of the boats.
example.tran: 有时海豚在船的尾流中嬉戏。

entry.def: A wake is a gathering or social event that is held before or after someone's funeral.

example.ex: A funeral wake was in progress.

entry.def: If one thing follows in the wake of another, it happens after the other thing is over, often as a result of it.

example.ex: The governor has enjoyed a huge surge in the polls in the wake of last week's convention...
example.tran: 上周的大会过后，民意调查显示州长支持率大幅上升。

example.ex: The company is in bankruptcy proceedings in the wake of a strike that began last spring.
example.tran: 去年春天开始的罢工一结束，这家公司就进入了破产程序。

entry.tran: 醒着的时间;非睡眠时间
entry.def: Your waking hours are the times when you are awake rather than asleep.

example.ex: It was work which consumed most of his waking hours...
example.tran: 他醒着的时候大部分时间都在工作。

example.ex: Most of their waking hours are spent eating.
example.tran: 他们醒着时大部分时间都在吃东西。

entry.def: If you leave something or someone in your wake, you leave them behind you as you go.

example.ex: Adam stumbles on, leaving a trail of devastation in his wake...
example.tran: 亚当蹒跚而行，沿路留下毁坏的痕迹。

example.ex: The tanks left burning vehicles in their wake as they ploughed through makeshift barricades.
example.tran: 坦克冲过临时搭建的路障，所过之处留下了燃烧的车辆。

entry.def: If you are following in someone's wake, you are following them or their example.

example.ex: In his wake came a waiter wheeling a trolley.
example.tran: 一位推着手推车的侍者紧随着他过来。

example.ex: ...the endless stream of female artists who released albums in her wake.
example.tran: 无数效仿她发行专辑的女艺术家

means.word_mean: 1. the consequences of an event (especially a catastrophic event);

sentences.sentence: "in the wake of the accident no one knew how many had been injured"

means.word_mean: 2. the wave that spreads behind a boat as it moves forward;
3. a vigil held over a corpse the night before burial;

sentences.sentence: "there's no weeping at an Irish wake"

means.word_mean: 1. be awake, be alert, be there

sentences.sentence: "She woke up to the sound of the alarm clock"

means.word_mean: 3. arouse or excite feelings and passions;

sentences.sentence: "The ostentatious way of living of the rich ignites the hatred of the poor"
"The refugees' fate stirred up compassion around the world"
"His words woke us to terrible facts of the situation"

means.word_mean: 5. cause to become awake or conscious;

sentences.sentence: "He was roused by the drunken men in the street"

example.en: If it's not the real wake-up pill, I don't want it.
example.zh: 假如这不是真的兴奋丸，我可不要。

auth_sentence.content: Otherwise, you might wake up and have nothing.
auth_sentence.res_content: Otherwise, you might wake up and have nothing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Otherwise, you might wake up and have nothing.

auth_sentence.content: This is a big wake-up call for policy makers.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is a big wake-up call for policy makers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is a big wake-up call for policy makers.

auth_sentence.content: The movie was meant to be a wake-up call.
auth_sentence.res_content: The movie was meant to be a wake-up call.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The movie was meant to be a wake-up call.

Sentence.sentence: This emerging model is now big and disruptive (颠覆性的) enough for regulators and companies to have woken up to it
She'd wake up early, turn on her laptop and chat on Internet dating sites and instant-messaging programs – leaving her bed for only brief intervals.
These changes have cleared up much of the confusion and conflict that followed in the wake of 1976 legislation.
He was very friendly, after I woke up that is.

sentences.en: When I woke the sun was three poles high.
sentences.cn: 我醒来时, 已日上三竿了。

sentences.en: The child woke three times during the night.
I woke to find that he had gone.
sentences.cn: 我醒来时发现他已经走了。

sentences.en: The scene woke memories of my boyhood.
sentences.cn: 这幕情景使我回忆起童年的往事。
音乐引起了难过的回忆。

sentences.en: A clap of thunder wakes the hills.
